titlestmt.titleproper: Ford Foundation records, New Delhi, India Office, Office Files of Vanita Mukherjee
A Guide to the Ford Foundation records, New Delhi, India Office, Office Files of Vanita Mukherjee FA661

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2025-01-01 05:04:40 UTC.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Ford Foundation records, New Delhi, India Office, Office Files of Vanita Mukherjee

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Records more than 10 years old are open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Ford Foundation archive was deposited at the RAC in 2011. Ford Foundation records, correspondence, reports, program files, and officers' papers were transferred to and accessioned by the RAC beginning in 2011.
This material was transferred to the RAC in 2021 and was ingested by the RAC as Accession 2021:082.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Ford Foundation has title, copyright and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them.

The Rockefeller Archive Center has authority to grant permission to cite and publish material from the collection. Permission to publish extensive excerpts, or material in its entirety, will be referred to the Ford Foundation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Collection contains the office files that Vanita Nayak Mukherjee created when she served as a Program Officer for the Ford Foundation's New Delhi, India Regional Office. The New Delhi Regional Office oversees programming for the countries of India, Nepal, and Sri Lanka. Mukherjee's office files collection consists of one series of program strategy related records that concern the New Delhi Office's program strategy for sexuality and reproductive health in India as well as program strategy at the Ford Foundation in a broader sense.

Common materials found in the collection include correspondence, drafts, notes, reports, agendas, meeting minutes, other meeting materials, tables, procedure guidelines, and publications. In addition to the materials Mukherjee created during her tenure at the Ford Foundation from 2006 to 2018, there are also earlier records that she may have either received, inherited, or gathered. These materials appear to have been used to help inform Mukherjee's work with formulating program strategy, to get her acquainted with Foundation practices and procedures for grant making, and for the commemoration of the New Delhi Office's 50th anniversary in 2002.
